sub_title: Analytics. Business & Scientific Modeling. Applied Physics & Petrophysics.
summary:
I am a physicist and an IT analyst, with a current focus on Big Data and Analytics, an extensive background in Petro-Physics, Geo-Sciences and Applied Earth Sciences, and with key expertises in mathematical, statistical and business modeling.

I have 10+ years of working experience in scientific programming and data analytics, as well as in the development of algorithms and numerical models for a wide range of application domains (oil and gas, planetary and subsurface exploration, agriculture and environmental sciences, logistics, electrical appliances).

I'm a scientific modeler, keen to combine his analytical and programming skills for tackling new challenges while working on "hot" industry fields.

Currently working with data warehouse architectures, cloud solutions, data platforms, and BI & reporting tools.

Tasks:
• Petrophysical evaluation of logs, core (RCA and SCAL), cuttings and well formation data
• Integration of petrophysical outputs into static and dynamic models
• Support to reservoir modeling, hydrocarbon reserves estimation
• Log, Geomechanical and Geochimical analyses
• Unconventional studies
• Unitization and redetermination support
• Mathematical modeling of petrophysical outputs
• Subsidence evaluation and geomechanics
• Uncertainty and statistical analyses
• Research and Development studies for unconventional reservoirs and for new business areas
• Participation in data rooms, peer reviews and client meetings
• Preparation of technical papers, technical and client presentations.', 'title': 'Senior Petrophysicist', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 166529, 'name': 'TU Delft', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4E0BAQFwaGpwaod9mQ/company-logo_400_400/0/1670699851986?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=772a-buTMRhp4JFw5Lp2WIlZQJ_rGzWG5O_wmvG3oQQ', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/tudelft/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'TUDelft University, Delft, The Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'company': 'Delft University of Technology', 'description': 'Scientific Consultant: released a feasibility study (performed by developing and computing numerical models) about the reliability of using innovative electromagnetic techniques for land surveys.

Project: Turning noise into signal. Development of a novel approach to detect hydrocarbon reservoirs in the Earth subsurface by applying Interferometry to the natural electromagnetic noise.

Tasks:
• Acquired knowledge on Natural Electromagnetic Array (Neat Interferometry) technique.
• Developed a numerical forward model to investigate the spatial spectral components of electromagnetic signals generated by far and randomly oriented noisy sources.
• Implemented and compared pseudo 3D and full finite-difference 3D models to describe the interaction between the electromagnetic fields and the Earth.
• Synthetic data analyzed by using Interferometry by Multicomponent Decomposition-by-Deconvolution (MDD).
• Synthetic data analyzed by using the Controlled Source Electromagnetic (CSEM) field decomposition approach.
• Evaluated the sensitivity of the Interferometry by Deconvolution in detecting subsurface hydrocarbon reservoirs by using Ultra-Low Frequency fields.
• Investigated the relationship between the Magnetotelluric and the MDD response.
• Magnetotelluric Processing.
• Subsurface Modeling by using GOCad Mining Suite.

Teaching activity: Day-to-Day supervision of two PhD projects.
• Reconstruction of sub-wavelength fractures using full-waveform inversion of proximal penetrating radar (stepped frequency GPR).
• Study of electrical and geomechanical properties of peaty soils.', 'title': 'Geoscientist/Researcher/Software Developer (Shell Int E&P and TUDelft University)', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 971268, 'name': 'REALTECH Italia S.p.A.', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQGmH19rdlBNOA/company-logo_400_400/0/1519876033436?e=1700092800&v=beta&t=cW3U3oOBwGwD7KdYq5uu04c7ZhDI5PTV_70HysNcBPc', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/realtech-italia-s.p.a./', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Rome Area, Italy', 'date': {'start': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}}, 'company': 'REALTECH Italia S.p.A.', 'description': 'Tasks:

Projects: 
i) Studies and research in the field of High Performance Computing, Grid, Cloud and GPU Computing, in their theoretical aspects and applications for the COMETA consortium.

• Ground Penetrating Radar surveys conducted on Archeological sites.
• Experimental electromagnetic characterization of soils polluted with non aqueous phase liquid contaminants.
